snippet: Even though the Arizona Constitution limits governors to two terms, Ms. Brewer had talked lately about trying to find a way around it.
abstract: Arizona Gov Jan Brewer, Republican whose approval of controversial measures on immigration and abortion have repeatedly put her in the national spotlight, announces that she will not run for re-election, ending speculation that she might seek a third term.

byline.contributor: Fernanda Santos contributed reporting from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: Even though the Arizona Constitution limits governors to two terms, Ms. Brewer had talked lately about trying to find a way around it.

headline.main: Arizona Governor With Tough Immigration and Abortion Stands Won’t Run Again
headline.print_headline: Arizona Governor With Tough Immigration and Abortion Stands Won’t Run Again
